intro: Pinalia leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender-fruit pinyon, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Pinaceae, which includes various coniferous trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, cone-like structures that contain edible seeds, which are often used as a food source by wildlife. Its leaves are needle-like and evergreen, typical of many conifer species. Pinalia leptocarpa thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
